About

I am a qaulified accountant from Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA). I started my career in Deloitte as a consultant in Enterprise Risk Services (ERS) department. After leaving Deloitte I joined Pakistan Broadcasters Association (PBA) as an Assistant Manager in their Clearance and Finance Departement. I left PBA as a Senior Manager to persue my own business. I am currently runing my own business of Textile Processing for Export Oriented Industry in Pakistan named Waqas Washing.

Education

I recieved my early education from Chiniot Islamia School & College, during my time in school I also became captain of the school cricket team as well as headboy of the school. I was introduced to HTML in my school. After completing my Matriculation Examinations I moved on to Dehli Government College to complete my Intermediate Examinations. After Intermediate I started studing for Certified Accounts Technician (CAT) Examination as I have always had an interest in Accounting and Finance. After completing the necessary CAT examinations I starte prepping for my ACCA examinations and cleared them in 2011. I also have very strong interest in Programming although I have had no formal education in coding I have however learned and practice enough to be proficient in it.

Pakistan Broadcasters Association

I started in Pakistan Broadcasters Association (PBA) as an Assistant Manager Clearance & Finance and was later promoted to Manager Clearance & Finance.

Key Roles and Responsiblities in PBA:

  • Monthly preparation of dues pending against Government of Pakistan & Government of Punjab (DGPR)
  • Record keeping of Suspension & Restoration of agencies
  • Preparation of Annual & Monthly performance reports for the Board of Directors.
  • Preparation of monthly payable ageing.
  • Preparation of reports on factual findings and reconciliation of media vendors with company`s ledgers.
  • Reconciliation of dues & payments of our Member Broadcasters with the Accredited Agencies.
  • Verification of a new or a shifting Client.
  • Dispute Resolution between Agencies, Member Broadcasters and Clients.
  • Verification of dues in case of shifting Clients.
  • Recovery of reported dues.
  • Resolving any issue pertaining to the assigned agencies and their clients.
  • Insuring compliance with the monthly clearance calendar of PBA.
  • Initiating disciplinary action against the defaulting agencies.
  • Letter & Report drafting for the recovery of dues from the Government of Pakistan.
  • Preparation of monthly clearance and outstanding position Report and Presentation.
